1.brief: elevation, i.e. the act (literally, a journey to a higher place, figuratively, a thought arising), or (concretely) the condition (literally, a step or grademark, figuratively, a superiority of station); specifically a climactic progression (in certain Psalms)
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

2.brief: Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to rest, i.e. settle down; used in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, intransitive, transitive and causative (to dwell, stay, let fall, place, let alone, withdraw, give comfort, etc.)
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, a pebble, i.e. a lot (small stones being used for that purpose); figuratively, a portion or destiny (as if determined by lot)
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),

4.brief: to be (transitively, do or make) good (or well) in the widest sense
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

5.brief: to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
